title: Cmd

title: Cmd.create
content: Cmd.create create Creates a CmdOptions with a command to run.

title: Cmd.createWithArgs
content: Cmd.createWithArgs createWithArgs Creates a CmdOptions with a command to run.

title: Cmd.args
content: Cmd.args args **Appends** the given arguments to the CmdOptions.

title: Cmd.argsMaybe
content: Cmd.argsMaybe argsMaybe **Appends** the given arguments to the CmdOptions if the condition is true.

title: Cmd.argMaybe
content: Cmd.argMaybe argMaybe **Appends** the given argument to the CmdOptions if the condition is true.

title: Cmd.argsOption
content: Cmd.argsOption argsOption **Appends** the given arguments to the CmdOptions if the option Some.

title: Cmd.argOption
content: Cmd.argOption argOption **Appends** the given argument to the CmdOptions if the option Some.

title: Cmd.argSecret
content: Cmd.argSecret argSecret **Appends** the given *secret* argument to the CmdOptions. Secret arguments are masked in console output.

title: Cmd.envVars
content: Cmd.envVars envVars **Appends** the given environment variables to the CmdOptions.

title: Cmd.workingDir
content: Cmd.workingDir workingDir Sets the working directory on the CmdOptions.

title: Cmd.prefix
content: Cmd.prefix prefix Sets the prefix option on the CmdOptions. This sets if the console output will be prefixed with the step name.

title: Cmd.timeout
content: Cmd.timeout timeout Sets the timeout option on the CmdOptions. This is the time in seconds before the command times out and is terminated. The timeout being reached causes a step failure.

title: Cmd.redirectOutput
content: Cmd.redirectOutput redirectOutput Sets the redirect option on the CmdOptions. This controls how the output of the process should be redirected. Check the options in RedirectOption for more information on each option.

title: Cmd.checkExitCode
content: Cmd.checkExitCode checkExitCode Sets the check exit code option on the CmdOptions. This sets if the exit code returned by the process should be checked. Check the options in ExitCodeCheckOption for more information on each option. The default is CheckCodeZero.

title: Cmd.result
content: Cmd.result result Runs a command/process with the specified options and returns a ProcessResult. The ProcessResult contains the exit code and optionally the redirected output if a redirect option was set. This method cannot be used if the output has not been redirected.

title: Cmd.run
content:
Cmd.run 
run 

 Runs a command/process with the specified options.

content:

title: ExitCodeCheckOption.CheckCodeZero
content: ExitCodeCheckOption.CheckCodeZero CheckCodeZero **Default**. Checks that the exit code is 0.

title: ExitCodeCheckOption.CheckCodeZeroWithMessage
content: ExitCodeCheckOption.CheckCodeZeroWithMessage CheckCodeZeroWithMessage Checks that the exit code is 0 and prints the specified message when it is not.

content:

CheckCodeWithMessage 

 Checks that the exit code is equal to the specified exit code and prints the specified message when it is not.

title: RedirectOption
content:
RedirectOption 

 Output redirection options.
  
RedirectOption.Redirect 
Redirect 
RedirectOption.RedirectToBoth

title: RedirectOption.Redirect
content: RedirectOption.Redirect Redirect Redirect the process output. This allows you to capture the output with Cmd.result, but does not print the output the console.

title: RedirectOption.RedirectToBoth
content: RedirectOption.RedirectToBoth RedirectToBoth Redirects the process output and prints to the console. This allows you to capture the output with Cmd.result and prints the output to the console.

title: Glob

title: Glob.create
content: Glob.create create Creates a Glob from a pattern.

title: Glob.createWithRootDir
content: Glob.createWithRootDir createWithRootDir Creates a Glob from a pattern with a root directory. The root directory is the path of a directory to start searching from.

title: Glob.add
content: Glob.add add Adds a pattern of paths to include to an existing Glob.

title: Glob.exclude
content: Glob.exclude exclude Adds a pattern of paths to exclude to an existing Glob.

title: Glob.toPaths
content: Glob.toPaths toPaths Creates a sequence of matched paths from a Glob.

title: Glob.toPathTypes
content: Glob.toPathTypes toPathTypes Creates a sequence of PathType from a Glob.

content: IWriterExtensions IWriter extension methods. IWriterExtensions.Write Write IWriterExtensions.WriteLine WriteLine IWriterExtensions.WriteLine WriteLine IWriterExtensions.WriteLines WriteLines

title: IWriterExtensions.Write
content: IWriterExtensions.Write Write Writes a Message to the console.

title: IWriterExtensions.WriteLine
content: IWriterExtensions.WriteLine WriteLine Writes a newline to the console. If the level is not high enough for the Verbosity, the line will not be written.

title: IWriterExtensions.WriteLine
content: IWriterExtensions.WriteLine WriteLine Writes a Message to the console, with a newline at the end.

title: IWriterExtensions.WriteLines
content: IWriterExtensions.WriteLines WriteLines Writes a Messagelist to the console, with newlines at the end of each.

title: Make
content: Make Module for working with a Make Make.BaseBuilder BaseBuilder Make.Builder Builder Make.MemoBuilder MemoBuilder Make.MemoRaceBuilder MemoRaceBuilder Make.RetryBuilder RetryBuilder Make.map map Make.bind bind Make.zip zip Make.zero zero Make.return' return' Make.context context Make.fail fail Make.failMessages failMessages Make.retry retry Make.memo memo Make.memoRace memoRace

title: Make.map
content:
Make.map map Takes a mapping function to create a new Make from the result of an existing Make.

This is typically used in computation expressions automatically, but can be used manually.

title: Make.bind
content:
Make.bind bind Takes a binder function to create a new Make from the result of an existing Make.

This is typically used in computation expressions automatically, but can be used manually.

title: Make.zip
content:
Make.zip zip Takes two Make and creates a tuple Make of their results.

This is typically used in computation expressions automatically, but can be used manually.

title: Make.zero
content:
Make.zero zero Creates an empty Make.

This is typically used in computation expressions automatically, but can be used manually.

title: Make.return'
content:
Make.return' return' Wraps a value in a Make.

This is typically used in computation expressions automatically, but can be used manually.

title: Make.context
content:
Make.context context Gets a Make that can be used to retrieve the current MakeContext.

This is typically used in computation expressions.

title: Make.fail
content: Make.fail fail Fails the current Make with a message.

title: Make.failMessages
content: Make.failMessages failMessages Fails the current Make with a list of Message to be printed. This can be used to create detailed multi-line failures.

title: Make.retry
content: Make.retry retry Creates a new Make from an existing one, that adds retry behaviour. This will "catch" all errors except for MakeAbort.

title: Make.memo
content:
Make.memo memo Memoizes a Make so it is only executed once. Subsequent executions return the result immediately.

This only allows single access to the Make, so if it is run in parallel, only one will run and the rest will block until a result is available.

title: Make.memoRace
content:
Make.memoRace memoRace Memoizes a Make so it is only executed once. Subsequent executions return the result immediately. Unlike Make.memo, this allows parallel executions to occur.

If it is run in parallel, it will be run multiple times until a result has been stored. Once a result has been stored, subsequent runs will immediately return the result.

title: MakeBuilders
content: MakeBuilders Auto-opened module containing functions for using Make computation expressions. MakeBuilders.make make MakeBuilders.retry retry MakeBuilders.memo memo MakeBuilders.memoRace memoRace

title: MakeBuilders.make
content: MakeBuilders.make make Creates a Make using a Builder computation expression.

title: MakeBuilders.retry
content: MakeBuilders.retry retry Creates a retry Make using a RetryBuilder computation expression.

title: MakeBuilders.memo
content:
MakeBuilders.memo memo Creates a single access memo Make using a MemoBuilder computation expression.

Once a memo has run, it will return the same value without running again.

title: MakeBuilders.memoRace
content:
MakeBuilders.memoRace memoRace Creates a parallel access memo Make using a MemoRaceBuilder computation expression.

Once a memoRace has run, it will return the same value without running again.

title: Pipelines
content: Pipelines Module for creating and working with Pipelines. Pipelines.Builder Builder Pipelines.create create Pipelines.runWithArgs runWithArgs Pipelines.runWithArgsAndExit runWithArgsAndExit

title: Pipelines.create
content: Pipelines.create create Use a computation expression builder to define Pipelines.

title: Pipelines.runWithArgs
content:
Pipelines.runWithArgs runWithArgs Runs a Pipeline from the given pipelines based on the command line arguments given in args.

Based on success or failure, returns a 0 or 1 exit code.

title: Pipelines.runWithArgsAndExit
content:
Pipelines.runWithArgsAndExit runWithArgsAndExit Runs a Pipeline from the given pipelines based on the command line arguments given in args.

Based on success or failure, exits the process with a 0 or 1 exit code.

WhenParallel

title: ProcessMonitor
content:
ProcessMonitor Module for working with the Agent.

This is used to track external processes launched by a pipeline.

ProcessMonitor.Agent Agent ProcessMonitor.create create ProcessMonitor.add add ProcessMonitor.remove remove ProcessMonitor.kill kill ProcessMonitor.isKilled isKilled ProcessMonitor.killAll killAll ProcessMonitor.shutdown shutdown

title: ProcessMonitor.create
content: ProcessMonitor.create create Creates a new Agent.

title: ProcessMonitor.add
content:
ProcessMonitor.add add Adds a process to be tracked.

Blocks until the message has been processed by the agent.

title: ProcessMonitor.remove
content:
ProcessMonitor.remove remove Removes a process from being tracked.

Blocks until the message has been processed by the agent.

title: ProcessMonitor.kill
content:
ProcessMonitor.kill kill Kills the specified process and tracks that it has been killed.

Blocks until the message has been processed by the agent.

title: ProcessMonitor.isKilled
content:
ProcessMonitor.isKilled isKilled Checks if the specified process has been killed.

Blocks until the message has been processed by the agent.

title: ProcessMonitor.killAll
content:
ProcessMonitor.killAll killAll Kills all processes tracked by the Agent.

Blocks until the message has been processed by the agent.

title: ProcessMonitor.shutdown
content:
ProcessMonitor.shutdown shutdown Shuts down the Agent. It will no longer function after being shut down.

Blocks until the message has been processed by the agent.

title: Agent

title: Make<'T>
content:
Make<'T> A Make represents a function that takes a MakeContext and returns a FSharpResult.

It allows various "pieces" that make up the execution of a step to be "glued" together and thread a MakeContext through.

title: FsMake
Use as a project
content:
---
title: Use as a project
category: Guides
categoryindex: 0
index: 0
---

# Use as a project

In the example below, replace `MyProject` with your root namespace(s).

Create a folder and a new console project in your solution directory.

    [lang=sh]
    mkdir MyProject.Build

    dotnet new console -lang F# -o MyProject.Build

    dotnet sln add MyProject.Build

Add a nuget reference to FsMake

    [lang=sh]
    // using paket
    dotnet paket add --project MyProject.Build FsMake

    // using nuget
    dotnet add MyProject.Build package FsMake

Open `MyProject.Build/Program.fs` and replace its contents with:

    [hide]
    #I "../../FsMake/bin/Release/netcoreapp3.1"
    #r "FsMake.dll"

<!-- Sep -->

    open FsMake

    [<EntryPoint>]
    let main argv =
        let restore =
            Step.create "restore" {
                do! Cmd.createWithArgs "dotnet" [ "restore" ] |> Cmd.run
            }

        let build =
            Step.create "build" {
                do! Cmd.createWithArgs "dotnet" [ "build" ] |> Cmd.run
            }

        Pipelines.create {
            let! build =
                Pipeline.create "build" {
                    run restore
                    run build
                }

            default_pipeline build
        }
        |> Pipelines.runWithArgs argv

To run your build:

    [lang=sh]
    dotnet run --project MyProject.Build

title: Use with paket load scripts
content:
---
title: Use with paket load scripts
category: Guides
categoryindex: 0
index: 1
---

# Use with paket load scripts

In your `paket.dependencies` file, add the following:

    [lang=text]
    group build
        storage: none
        framework: netcoreapp3.1
        source https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json

        nuget FsMake

Add the following to your `build.cmd` & `build.sh`:

    [lang=text]
    dotnet paket generate-load-scripts --group build

Create a `build.fsx` file at the root of your solution:

    [hide]
    #I "../../FsMake/bin/Release/netcoreapp3.1"
    #r "FsMake.dll"

<!-- Sep -->

    #load ".paket/load/netcoreapp3.1/build/build.group.fsx"

    open FsMake

    let restore =
        Step.create "restore" {
            do! Cmd.createWithArgs "dotnet" [ "restore" ] |> Cmd.run
        }

    let build =
        Step.create "build" {
            do! Cmd.createWithArgs "dotnet" [ "build" ] |> Cmd.run
        }

    Pipelines.create {
        let! build =
            Pipeline.create "build" {
                run restore
                run build
            }

        default_pipeline build
    }
    |> Pipelines.runWithArgsAndExit argv

To run your build:

    [lang=sh]
    dotnet fsi build.fsx

title: Concepts
content:
--- title: Concepts category: Documentation categoryindex: 1 index: 0 --- # Concepts FsMake's core concepts are: - [Pipelines](../reference/fsmake-pipeline.html) - [Stages](../reference/fsmake-stage.html) - [Steps](../reference/fsmake-step.html) A `pipeline` has a name and contains many `stages`. A `stage` has and name and contains one or more `steps`. Depending on the `stage`, these `steps` could be conditional and/or parallel. A `step` has a name and a special [Make<'T>](../reference/fsmake-make-1.html) function.
A step is where you define what you want to run. ## Make<'T> [Make<'T>](../reference/fsmake-make-1.html) is the core abstraction and extensibility point in FsMake. A `step` is composed of glued together `Make<'T>` functions. FsMake includes some computation expression builders for working with them.
See [MakeBuilders](../reference/fsmake-makebuilders.html).
